attributes.action: Stop Official Operations of Child Sexual Abuse and Exploitation
attributes.additional_details: Entrapment, sting operations, blackmail and bribery are operational strategies by the use and exploitation of children specifically as deception, soliciting, coercion, threat and similar to influence the actions of an official or other person in charge of decision making duties.  To use children in this context is unlawful by national and international laws.
attributes.background: To demand official, secret and security services immediately cease covert operations where child sexual abuse and exploitation are used to coerce and influence decision makers in private and public roles.

rejection.details: This is already illegal, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
